cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 310 mi south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north toward the central Louisiana coast, then forecast to turn northeast across Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City/Intracoastal City

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Intermittent tropical-storm-force gusts (35–40 mph) possible during Saturday while the center passes nearby.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along lower Mississippi River; significant surge not expected at the port’s location upriver.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals could cause flash and urban flooding in the Baton Rouge area beginning Friday night.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low-end tornado threat beginning Friday afternoon and continuing through Saturday.
